channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge pauses deadlines in Trump classified documents case over immunity questions
item.description: Trump has argued that him taking classified documents to his Mar-a-Lago home constituted an official act — and that the Supreme Court's ruling means the charges against him should be dropped.
item.content:encoded:
Trump has argued that him taking classified documents to his Mar-a-Lago home constituted an official act — and that the Supreme Court's ruling means the charges against him should be dropped.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Dave Mistich

item.title: Extreme heat grips West and East coasts, breaking daily highs
item.description: The heat wave in the U.S. is far from over. This weekend, parts of the Pacific Northwest and Northeast are bearing the brunt of the heat with record-breaking temperatures.
item.content:encoded:
The heat wave in the U.S. is far from over. This weekend, parts of the Pacific Northwest and Northeast are bearing the brunt of the heat with record-breaking temperatures.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Life Kit: Tips for managing joint bank accounts
item.description: Should you merge your finances with your significant other? Keep them separate? Or something in between? NPR's Life Kit breaks down different ways to handle finances with your partner.
item.content:encoded: Should you merge your finances with your significant other? Keep them separate? Or something in between? NPR's Life Kit breaks down different ways to handle finances with your partner.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Amid the Starliner delay, a former astronaut discusses being stuck in space
item.description: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with retired astronaut Terry Virts about what the Boeing Starliner astronauts might going through being in space longer than they thought they would be.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with retired astronaut Terry Virts about what the Boeing Starliner astronauts might going through being in space longer than they thought they would be.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Supreme Court immunity ruling likely to affect Trump's cases, says former DOJ official
item.description: NPR's Domenico Montanaro speaks with attorney and former DOJ official Harry Litman about how the Supreme Court's immunity ruling could affect the pending cases facing former President Trump.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Domenico Montanaro speaks with attorney and former DOJ official Harry Litman about how the Supreme Court's immunity ruling could affect the pending cases facing former President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: President Biden had a high-stakes interview. How did it go?
item.description: President Biden's interview from Wisconsin had an outsize importance for the future of his campaign. We look at how it went.
item.content:encoded: President Biden's interview from Wisconsin had an outsize importance for the future of his campaign. We look at how it went.
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Shooting at a birthday party in northern Kentucky leaves 4 people dead, 3 wounded
item.description: Police officers discovered seven people shot during a 21st birthday party in Florence, Ky., shortly before 3 a.m. Saturday. The suspected shooter later died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
item.content:encoded:
Police officers discovered seven people shot during a 21st birthday party in Florence, Ky., shortly before 3 a.m. Saturday. The suspected shooter later died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Kansas Supreme Court rules against strict abortion laws amidst an influx of patients
item.description: The Kansas Supreme Court ruled against two anti-abortion laws, suggesting other restrictions could fall. The state has received numerous patients from states with tighter laws.
item.content:encoded: The Kansas Supreme Court ruled against two anti-abortion laws, suggesting other restrictions could fall. The state has received numerous patients from states with tighter laws.
item.dc:creator: Rose Conlon

item.title: Week in politics: Biden tries to do debate damage control with ABC interview
item.description: President Biden gave an exclusive interview to ABC News Friday and tried to calm voters concerned about whether he should run for another term. We'll discuss how he did.
item.content:encoded: President Biden gave an exclusive interview to ABC News Friday and tried to calm voters concerned about whether he should run for another term. We'll discuss how he did.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Saturday Sports: Copa America and the U.S. men's soccer team, criminal probe into doping
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the US men's soccer team's flameout at Copa America and a criminal probe into doping.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the US men's soccer team's flameout at Copa America and a criminal probe into doping.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
